intro: Lithraea caustica var. pilosa, commonly known as the hairy lithraea, is a shrub native to the arid regions of South America. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its dense, hairy foliage that provides moisture retention. The plant has small, clustered flowers and produces a milky sap that can cause skin irritation. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Its unique morphology and ecological adaptations make it a notable species in its native habitat.
